0193feed-2940-71ba-9fc5-64122b4b79ff.name: Yours Truly Hotel Lobby
0193feed-2940-71ba-9fc5-64122b4b79ff.arrival: You arrive at the Yours Truly hotel, site of the first ever DistrictCon!
0193feed-2940-71ba-9fc5-64122b4b79ff.description: You look around the lobby. The decor is pretty cool, and there's a DistrictCon sign and registration table to your right with some conference *stickers* on it. A *volunteer* stands behind the table. Beyond the registration desk are the stairs to the *conference center* and to your left is the Mercy Me bar and restaurant. Behind you is the door out onto New Hampshire Ave NW and all of Washington, DC! The metro can take you anywhere you want to go, just head to the *metro station*.

018daa13-30b6-74a1-819f-ba0e795a6ce4.name: Mercy Me
018daa13-30b6-74a1-819f-ba0e795a6ce4.arrival: You walk into Mercy Me, the Yours Truly Hotel bar on the main floor.
018daa13-30b6-74a1-819f-ba0e795a6ce4.description: You see a bunch of folks hanging out, chatting, and hacking away on some burner laptops. Some are having snacks, some having a drink. The bartenders are scrambling around trying to keep everyone happy. Sitting at the bar is Winnona, DistrictCon's founder, working tirelessly to keep the whole show going.

018346eb-53ac-74a1-b4ab-14d69098e3a0.name: Call Your Mother
018346eb-53ac-74a1-b4ab-14d69098e3a0.arrival: You walk past the restaurant to the bagel shop.
018346eb-53ac-74a1-b4ab-14d69098e3a0.description: The shop smells amazing, and you really could use a nosh. There's no line right now, so probably the best time to get something. There's a clerk behind the counter, and a group of four people sitting by the window. Everyone in the group is wearing a different hoodie, and they all have their names on them, although you can only see three of them: w4sh1ngt0n, j3ff3rs0n, and l1nc0ln.

019447f9-b219-73d6-8d7e-bcec12d2af9c.name: Conference Center
019447f9-b219-73d6-8d7e-bcec12d2af9c.arrival: You walk into the main conference center space.
019447f9-b219-73d6-8d7e-bcec12d2af9c.description: There are lots of people in the conference center, some just walking through, some standing around talking. You see people with all sorts of different swag on their badges an Lanyards. One person has a Vanderbilt University pin on, you figure they must be a student there. You can see the main stage ahead of you, and various other rooms as well. 'It sure would be nice to have a map of the venue,' you think to yourself. You also notice a small staff room around the corner to the right. The elevator that leads to the Yours Truly Hotel lobby is behind you.
019447f9-b219-73d6-8d7e-bcec12d2af9c.notmet: A volunteer stops you at the elevator. "Sorry, but you'll need a conference badge to go up. Have checked in at the registration desk with Jenny?"

01944d58-f34c-775f-b6f4-dc0d40461ac0.name: Staff Room
01944d58-f34c-775f-b6f4-dc0d40461ac0.arrival: You look around but no one seems to be blocking the staff room, so you decide to take a peek inside.
01944d58-f34c-775f-b6f4-dc0d40461ac0.description: This is less of a 'room' and more of a storage closet. There's a bunch of boxes, but they're all taped up. Sitting on one of the boxes is a small usb drive. You think you hear someone coming toward the room, so you probably shouldn't stay long!

0191efc9-7099-7cc0-af5b-8f1057154d43.name: Server Room
0191efc9-7099-7cc0-af5b-8f1057154d43.notmet: The door is locked. Looks you need to find a key!
0191efc9-7099-7cc0-af5b-8f1057154d43.arrival: You use the server key you found on the server room door lock... it fits! You creak open the door and step inside.
0191efc9-7099-7cc0-af5b-8f1057154d43.description: The server room is actually a pretty posh looking lounge space. There's one person sitting in a nice plush chair mashing keys on their laptop. You say 'Hi!' but there's no response. You might need to say their name to get their attention.

019485a6-c0c6-736c-8eab-a2e4afac7233.name: Main Stage
019485a6-c0c6-736c-8eab-a2e4afac7233.arrival: You stroll into the largest session space in the conference center.
019485a6-c0c6-736c-8eab-a2e4afac7233.description: The main stage is where many of the conference talks will take place. There are screens at the front, a stage in the center, and rows and rows of chairs. There's an AV tech at the back checking some of the sound boards and a speaker chatting with some people with questions. A volunteer stands at the door looking around a bit frantically.

01949f41-8f5f-7558-8038-0820979b2de2.name: Jump the Wall
01949f41-8f5f-7558-8038-0820979b2de2.arrival: You walk into a dark space lit only by the dim screens of many laptops.
01949f41-8f5f-7558-8038-0820979b2de2.description: The space is rumbles with the murmur of so many hackers trying their best to overcome an invisible hurdle. You notice that most people are heads down on their computers, but every once in a while you hear an excited cry from a lone hacker... they found something. In the corner you spot RoRo, one of the DisCo organizers, keeping an eye on the activities.

01805090-e6f6-7582-bf41-2527c143e62d.name: Hacker Policy Room
01805090-e6f6-7582-bf41-2527c143e62d.arrival: You walk into the medium-sized conference space labelled 'DisCo Policy'
01805090-e6f6-7582-bf41-2527c143e62d.description: The DisCo Policy room is where thought leaders will shape the future of digital policy. You arrive between sessions and find a few different people hanging around, chatting about the state of cybersecurity policy and regulations in the U.S. To your right is a small table for the moderator of the roundtables to sit.

01803dd9-9388-72db-8f0e-dd84bf43c56f.name: Chill Out Room
01803dd9-9388-72db-8f0e-dd84bf43c56f.arrival: You walk into the darkened Chill Out room and immediately feel your anxiety lowering.
01803dd9-9388-72db-8f0e-dd84bf43c56f.description: This quiet, dark space is where you can go to hang out, decompress, and generally chill. You don't have to worry about anything when you're in here. There's only one other attendee here right now, they see you come in and give a small head nod.

01949f41-f35b-724c-8a12-5ec3846bd3b6.name: Village of Villages
01949f41-f35b-724c-8a12-5ec3846bd3b6.arrival: You walk into the Village of Villages space.
01949f41-f35b-724c-8a12-5ec3846bd3b6.description: This space is for the Villages represented at DistrictCon to exhibit and engage. Villages are an underutilized resource for policymakers who want to understand and make change in cyber security. Looking around you see a number of tables for the various villages and all sorts of cool gear laying around to play with. There's a person standing next to you in the doorway with one of those Vanderbilt pins on their badge, you guess it's a student. They appear to be in shock from all the cool stuff. At the tables spread out in the room are representatives from Red Teams, Blue Teams, and everything in between!

01939d34-ce4d-793f-bf65-ec1bfdd6521c.name: Red Team Village
01939d34-ce4d-793f-bf65-ec1bfdd6521c.arrival: You walk over to the Red Team Village table to check it out.
01939d34-ce4d-793f-bf65-ec1bfdd6521c.description: This is the RTV table. There are some stickers on the table, a couple laptops showing some terminal output, and there's a volunteer standing behind it.

0190328f-8e38-7b28-b5b9-bf9169b955b0.name: Biohacking Village
0190328f-8e38-7b28-b5b9-bf9169b955b0.arrival: You walk over to the Biohacking Village table to check it out.
0190328f-8e38-7b28-b5b9-bf9169b955b0.description: This is the Biohacking table. There are some stickers on the table, a DNA machine, and there's a volunteer standing behind it.

0182c3c5-7c4f-70ff-9a48-dfe702f0aba3.name: Aerospace Village
0182c3c5-7c4f-70ff-9a48-dfe702f0aba3.arrival: You walk over to the Aerospace Village table to check it out.
0182c3c5-7c4f-70ff-9a48-dfe702f0aba3.description: This is the Aerospace table. There are some stickers on the table, a couple models of airplanes, and a laptop showing some terminal output.

018b78f4-26bf-72ec-8bed-2a77eef32127.name: ICS Village
018b78f4-26bf-72ec-8bed-2a77eef32127.arrival: You walk over to the Industrial Control Systems Village table to check it out.
018b78f4-26bf-72ec-8bed-2a77eef32127.description: This is the ICS Village table. There are some stickers on the table, a couple models of industrial systems, and a laptop showing some terminal output.

017ecbc4-9cdb-7f9f-b45e-9a4fa3228856.name: Carhacking Village
017ecbc4-9cdb-7f9f-b45e-9a4fa3228856.arrival: You walk over to the Carhacking Village table to check it out.
017ecbc4-9cdb-7f9f-b45e-9a4fa3228856.description: This is the Carhacking Village table. There are some stickers on the table, a couple models of vehicles, and a laptop showing some terminal output.

01819137-457b-7288-925d-88c720c3e478.name: Maritime Hacking Village
01819137-457b-7288-925d-88c720c3e478.arrival: You walk over to the Maritime Hacking Village table to check it out.
01819137-457b-7288-925d-88c720c3e478.description: This is the Maritime Hacking Village table. There are some stickers on the table, a couple models of boats, and a laptop showing some terminal output.

017b1fd5-2476-7b01-9e31-a20f3e8532b8.name: Voting Village
017b1fd5-2476-7b01-9e31-a20f3e8532b8.arrival: You walk over to the Voting Village table to check it out.
017b1fd5-2476-7b01-9e31-a20f3e8532b8.description: This is the Voting Village table. There are some stickers on the table, a model of a digital ballot box, and a laptop showing some terminal output.

018f02a9-7967-7473-b885-b99ed57a3555.name: Blue Team Village
018f02a9-7967-7473-b885-b99ed57a3555.arrival: You walk over to the Blue Team Village table to check it out.
018f02a9-7967-7473-b885-b99ed57a3555.description: This is the BTV table. There are some stickers on the table, a couple laptops showing some terminal output, and there's a volunteer standing behind it.

018fa71f-321f-7273-bebb-29265d2b4ea1.name: Restroom
018fa71f-321f-7273-bebb-29265d2b4ea1.arrival: You stop into the restoom between talks and are happy to see how clean they are!
018fa71f-321f-7273-bebb-29265d2b4ea1.description: The restroom is clean and well maintained. You notice that someone has left a DC metro map on the counter. There's a few signs on a board next to the door, one of them is advertising a retro video gamer meetup at a popular game shop in DC called Labyrinth. 'Okay, enough standing here looking around,' you think to yourself.

01700b1e-0108-7aa9-9ddd-fcda86d129c2.name: Junkyard
01700b1e-0108-7aa9-9ddd-fcda86d129c2.arrival: You pop into the Junkyard room to see what's going on there.
01700b1e-0108-7aa9-9ddd-fcda86d129c2.description: The room is filled with people hacking away at ancient relics of tech. There's lots of weird old tech here, one hacker is even tinkering with an old Nintendo system. It is a platform to showcase novel security research and support hobby and career development for security researchers. It looks like people are bringing their most impactful, creative, or most meme-worthy bugs in end-of-life (EOL) products, and demonstrating them live on stage!

017e461d-dbfd-702b-9ea5-bf321b42b6bc.name: Blue Sky Innovators Sponsor Table
017e461d-dbfd-702b-9ea5-bf321b42b6bc.arrival: You walk up to the Blue Sky Innovators table.
017e461d-dbfd-702b-9ea5-bf321b42b6bc.description: The person behind the table says 'Hi! Thanks for finding Blue Sky Innovators! Be sure to check out the Hacker DisCo on Friday night!'

0176b07c-dda8-7233-97ae-999bd236bb27.name: Vigilant Labs Sponsor Table
0176b07c-dda8-7233-97ae-999bd236bb27.arrival: You walk up to the Vigilant Labs table.
0176b07c-dda8-7233-97ae-999bd236bb27.description: The person behind the table says 'Hello! Thanks for finding Vigilant Labs, sponsors of The Junkyard at DistrictCon. You can reach us at contact@vigilantlabs.com'

018a7a09-bc11-7958-b830-e13a3cd77666.name: Interrupt Labs Sponsor Table
018a7a09-bc11-7958-b830-e13a3cd77666.arrival: You walk up to the Interrupt Labs table.
018a7a09-bc11-7958-b830-e13a3cd77666.description: The person behind the table says 'Hi! Thanks for finding Interrupt Labs, sponsors of The Junkyard at DistrictCon. Check out our roles at https://www.interruptlabs.com'

01753719-af19-7f31-a809-5f9282ebf678.name: Corellium Sponsor Table
01753719-af19-7f31-a809-5f9282ebf678.arrival: You walk up to the Corellium table.
01753719-af19-7f31-a809-5f9282ebf678.description: The person behind the table says 'Hello! Thanks for finding Corellium. Check out our tools and free trial at https://Corellium.com'

017ee596-bfd7-7354-adfe-b387d9f48e41.name: HackerOne Sponsor Table
017ee596-bfd7-7354-adfe-b387d9f48e41.arrival: You walk up to the HackerOne table.
017ee596-bfd7-7354-adfe-b387d9f48e41.description: The person behind the table says 'Hi! Thanks for finding HackerOne. Check out our hacker community at https://hackerone.com'

0171491d-9172-739d-82cd-365201f8ed25.name: Magnet Forensics Sponsor Table
0171491d-9172-739d-82cd-365201f8ed25.arrival: You walk up to the Magnet Forensics table.
0171491d-9172-739d-82cd-365201f8ed25.description: The person behind the table says 'Hi! Thanks for finding Magnet Forensics. Unlock the truth and protect the innocent with https://magnetforensics.com'

018c4f12-8d4e-71e4-848f-778f468b4679.name: KC7 Sponsor Table
018c4f12-8d4e-71e4-848f-778f468b4679.arrival: You walk up to the KC7 Foundation table.
018c4f12-8d4e-71e4-848f-778f468b4679.description: The person behind the table says 'Hi! Thanks for finding KC7. You can check out our free detective game on https://kc7cyber.com'

0170e88e-cb2b-74ff-9428-ebb1099bf181.name: Bugcrowd Sponsor Table
0170e88e-cb2b-74ff-9428-ebb1099bf181.arrival: You walk up to the Bugcrowd table.
0170e88e-cb2b-74ff-9428-ebb1099bf181.description: The person behind the table says 'Hi! Thanks for finding Bugcrowd, sponsors of The Junkyard at DistrictCon. You can learn more about our platform at https://bugcrowd.com'

016fcd5d-23af-7169-94e6-fa6af26fa84d.name: Margin Research Sponsor Table
016fcd5d-23af-7169-94e6-fa6af26fa84d.arrival: You walk up to the (virtual) Margin Research table.
016fcd5d-23af-7169-94e6-fa6af26fa84d.description: The person behind the table says 'Nice, you found us! If you want to know more, you can reach out at contact@margin.re'

018c0485-48e1-77ed-a212-8f0f519bf7ce.name: Draper Sponsor Table
018c0485-48e1-77ed-a212-8f0f519bf7ce.arrival: You walk up to the (virtual) Draper table.
018c0485-48e1-77ed-a212-8f0f519bf7ce.description: The person behind the table says 'Nice, you found us! If you want to know more, you can reach out at contact@margin.re'

0191ba3b-fb12-77a3-ab21-194b8cdd6cb6.name: AWS Sponsor Table
0191ba3b-fb12-77a3-ab21-194b8cdd6cb6.arrival: You walk up to the (virtual) AWS table.
0191ba3b-fb12-77a3-ab21-194b8cdd6cb6.description: The person behind the table says 'Nice, you found us! For more information, check out https://aws.amazon.com'

0184feb6-1ab6-7f84-9677-fd0c5fce6b8d.name: BishopFox Sponsor Table
0184feb6-1ab6-7f84-9677-fd0c5fce6b8d.arrival: You walk up to the (virtual) BishopFox table.
0184feb6-1ab6-7f84-9677-fd0c5fce6b8d.description: The person behind the table says 'Nice, you found us! For more information, check out https://bishopfox.com'

018bb28e-3e9d-70ff-9761-3e2048179264.name: Reach Security Sponsor Table
018bb28e-3e9d-70ff-9761-3e2048179264.arrival: You walk up to the (virtual) Reach Security table.
018bb28e-3e9d-70ff-9761-3e2048179264.description: The person behind the table says 'Nice, you found us! For more information, check out https://reach.security'

01709dde-3bba-7300-bbae-ace7db481bfc.name: National Malware Association Sponsor Table
01709dde-3bba-7300-bbae-ace7db481bfc.arrival: You walk up to the (virtual) National Malware Association table.
01709dde-3bba-7300-bbae-ace7db481bfc.description: The person behind the table says 'The right to bear arms includes malware. Visit us at https://nationalmalware.org'

0193feee-0b82-704a-aeba-ce40029e7b7e.name: Metro station
0193feee-0b82-704a-aeba-ce40029e7b7e.arrival: You are at the metro station, you can get just about anywhere in DC on the metro!
0193feee-0b82-704a-aeba-ce40029e7b7e.description: This is a typical Washington, DC metro station. It has high ceilings and low lighting. There is a station manager in their booth straight ahead with some maps. There's lots of people hustling around, but you spot a clearly lost man wandering among the crowd.

01945c61-418d-765a-82a2-b06d872dac99.name: Som Records
01945c61-418d-765a-82a2-b06d872dac99.arrival: The shop is in a half-basement space of a red-brick building. You step in and enter another world.
01945c61-418d-765a-82a2-b06d872dac99.description: Inside you find plenty of sweet vinyl, both in boxes and adorning the walls and ceiling. It's tight inside, but not too crowded thankfully. There's a player to one side for listening before you buy. You start fliping through albums and right away see some amazing options. Toward the back you see a door simply labeled 'Som back room'.

01945c61-8a20-71eb-b7df-a6b72e27d5a8.name: Som back room
01945c61-8a20-71eb-b7df-a6b72e27d5a8.arrival: You say the password and they let you into the back room.
01945c61-8a20-71eb-b7df-a6b72e27d5a8.description: There are racks and racks of old vinyl, all disco. There's a low thumping disco vibe playing and only a couple other people there. You rifle through the stacks, but only thing stands out: a record labelled 'DistrictCon Soundtrack'. Surely that can't be for this event, right?

018fd473-f1dd-78a4-9624-2139066c61e3.name: Labyrinth Games
018fd473-f1dd-78a4-9624-2139066c61e3.arrival:
The unassuming front is decorated with a simple green awning and a sign that says 'Weekly Labyrinth Puzzle' and then two equations:
abc + 123 = bdf
dad + b0b = ?
018fd473-f1dd-78a4-9624-2139066c61e3.description: Inside you see there are a few different rooms, all filled with games of all sorts. There are dice games, card games, board games, puzzles, and even retro video games. There's a sign that says there's a retro gamer meetup next week. You see a few different employees helping customers, chatting about games. They seem very knowledgeable. An employee behind the counter is waving at you and says 'Welcome!'
